intro: Cheirinia asperrima, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and yellow composite flowers that consist of many small florets. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, bristly hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cheirinia asperrima is often found in open fields and along coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
